revised_title: Comparative Study of Ancient Weights, Measures, and Monuments
tldr: The author compares various ancient weights, measures, and monuments from different countries and cultures, including the English foot, Hebrew Secel, Attic Tetradrachm, and Egyptian pyramids. They provide geometric calculations and historical context to establish the relationships between these measurements and assert the equality of certain units across cultures. The author also discusses the value of ancient weights in terms of modern currency and the importance of preserving historical monuments.
